title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: U.S. stocks follow Asia, Europe down on fear that Nvidia, other superstars are overvalued
items.description: After quickly sliding to a morning loss of 1.5%, the S&P 500 clawed back nearly all of it before sinking again. It finished with a fall of 0.8%.

items.title: Federal Court Blocks Texas’ Republican-Friendly Congressional Map
items.description: The move dealt a blow to efforts by Texas Republicans and President Trump to flip Democratic seats in the state. Gov. Greg Abbott said the state would...

items.title: On Republican Neo-Nazism, Hamas and Israel: An Epidemic of Moral Cowardice
items.description: People with extreme ideology don’t care anymore about hiding their excesses or their agendas. It’s all out there online or on YouTube.

items.title: Trump Administration Announces Steps to Dismantle Education Department
items.description: Responsibilities for K-12 and college programs, among others, will be moved to other federal agencies.

items.title: Kamala Harris Hits Campaign Trail in Tennessee Special Election
items.description: On Tuesday, the former vice president made her first campaign appearance for another Democrat since leaving office.

items.title: Meta prevails in historic FTC antitrust case, won’t have to break up WhatsApp, Instagram
items.description: U.S. District Judge James Boasberg issued his ruling Tuesday after the historic antitrust trial wrapped up in late May.

items.title: ‘Things Happen’: Trump Brushes Off the Murder of Khashoggi
items.description: A reporter asked Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman about the murder of the Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi. President Trump interjected.

items.title: House votes 427-1 to release Epstein files in remarkable rebuke to Trump
items.description: Both President Trump and Speaker Mike Johnson failed in their efforts to prevent the vote

items.title: ‘Bond King’ Jeffrey Gundlach warns of the next financial crisis: ‘It has the same trappings as subprime mortgage repackaging in 2006’
items.description: The billionaire founder of DoubleLine Capital is also convinced the $38 trillion national debt will be addressed before 2030: "something has to happen...

items.title: Exclusive: Crypto exchange Kraken raises $200 million from Ken Griffin’s Citadel Securities to notch $20 billion valuation
items.description: Once skittish about digital assets, Citadel has warmed towards the crypto business in 2025.

items.title: Investigating a Recycling Disaster
items.description: We went to Nigeria, where recycling plants are extracting lead for use in American and European car batteries — at a terrible human cost.

items.title: The Saudi crown prince receives an especially warm welcome at the White House.
The Auto Industry’s Lead Recycling Program is Poisoning People
items.description: We documented the toxic fallout of a green technology.

items.title: U.S. Military Threat Puts Spotlight on Venezuela’s Allies
items.description: American adversaries are unlikely to help President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela fend off a concerted attack. But they have made toppling him harder.

items.title: Live Updates: Trump Praises Saudi Prince and Dismisses Question About Killing of Journalist
